alert.note: Alert for Bennington; Eastern Windham; Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 1:24PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Bennington and Windham Counties through 200 PM EDT... At 123 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over mainly rural areas of northeastern Bennington and Windham Counties, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bellows Falls, Londonderry, Townshend, Stratton, Putney, Saxtons River, Westminster, Newfane, West Wardsboro, Manchester Center, Windham, Rockingham, Dover, Jamaica, Wardsboro, Grafton, Brookline, Athens, Peru and North Westminster. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Vermont.
